pullrequest.title: Add basic support for Image output types

content.raw:
Oh, I see. You are not actually using an `IMAGE` object or widget in your lightcrafter device. If used, the `IMAGE` object stores the image as a base64 encoded string, so there is technically a front panel value to compare to. I agree that we can’t store that in the h5 file though with the other front panel settings yet because it expects a float \(we should probably add an additional column for storing string data\).

It’s probably easiest to ignore these for now and add issues for them to be fixed later as part of a more broad integration/generalisation for DMD and SLM devices.
content.html:
Oh, I see. You are not actually using an IMAGE object or widget in your lightcrafter device. If used, the IMAGE object stores the image as a base64 encoded string, so there is technically a front panel value to compare to. I agree that we can’t store that in the h5 file though with the other front panel settings yet because it expects a float (we should probably add an additional column for storing string data).

It’s probably easiest to ignore these for now and add issues for them to be fixed later as part of a more broad integration/generalisation for DMD and SLM devices.
